intro: Echites pinifolius, commonly known as the needleleaf echites, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its needle-like leaves, which are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Echites pinifolius is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in moist, well-drained soils.
